content:
• Thursday, October 11, 2012
  • JBHT

    More on J.B. Hunt (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q3 comes in mixed, missing slightly on a per share basis but...

    More on J.B. Hunt (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q3 comes in mixed, missing slightly on a per share basis but beating on total revenue. Net earnings rose 14% Y/Y however, on strong performance from its intermodal division and better margins. Revenue per load edged lower by 0.1%, but was largely offset a 15% increase in load volume. Shares +4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • OZK

    Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK): FQ3 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Shares +1% AH. (PR)

    Bank of the Ozarks (OZRK): FQ3 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI) -2.5% AH on news that selling shareholders will commence a public...

    Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI) -2.5% AH on news that selling shareholders will commence a public offering of ~69.3M shares of common stock. Neither KMI nor KMI's management is selling any shares in the offering, and KMI will receive none of the proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR) +2.5% AH after adding 3 new board members, including Steven Tesoriere, co-founder of...

    MEMC (WFR) +2.5% AH after adding 3 new board members, including Steven Tesoriere, co-founder of activist investor Atlai Capital. Atlai owns a sizable stake in MEMC, and has been demanding a board seat for months. The other additions (likely allied with Atlai) are Antonio Alvarez, COO of image sensor firm Aptina Imaging, and Jeffry Quinn, CEO of investment holding firm The Quinn Group. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • AMD

    AMD -7.8% AH after warning it expects Q3 revenue to fall 10% Q/Q, well below prior guidance of...

    AMD -7.8% AH after warning it expects Q3 revenue to fall 10% Q/Q, well below prior guidance of -4% to +2%. Gross margin is expected to be just 31% vs. prior guidance of 44%, partly thanks to a $100M inventory write-down. The chipmaker says it's seeing weak demand across all product lines - slumping PC sales are having an effect, but the size of the drop also suggests share losses to Intel and/or Nvidia. INTC -0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 33 Comments
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q3 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.3B...

    J.B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q3 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.3B (+11% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • NOK

    After trading near breakeven much of the day, Alcatel Lucent (ALU +7.9%) shot higher in...

    After trading near breakeven much of the day, Alcatel Lucent (ALU +7.9%) shot higher in afternoon trading, rising all the way to $1. There hasn't been any news to spark the move, though the struggling telecom equipment vendor could benefit from a Sprint/SoftBank deal if it boosts Sprint's 4G LTE capex - Alcatel is one of the suppliers for Sprint's LTE buildout.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • BA

    Citigroup sees some compelling reasons to buy Boeing (BA +1%) at current levels, saying its...

    Citigroup sees some compelling reasons to buy Boeing (BA +1%) at current levels, saying its December board meeting should produce a 20% dividend hike and a $2B-plus share repurchase program. The firm reiterates its Buy rating with an $89 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • ENG

    ENGlobal (ENG +10.2%) shares surge on news it hired Simmons & Co. to explore possible...

    ENGlobal (ENG +10.2%) shares surge on news it hired Simmons & Co. to explore possible strategic alternatives, including a sale of the company or some of its assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • FSM

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +6.1%) reports record production of 1.03M oz. of silver and 5,348 oz....

    Fortuna Silver Mines (FSM +6.1%) reports record production of 1.03M oz. of silver and 5,348 oz. of gold during Q3. Silver and gold production for the first nine months of 2012 reflects 80% and 94% of FSM's total 2012 production guidance; at the current rate, FSM is on track to exceed its forecast of 3.7M oz. of silver and 17.4K oz. of gold.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • TMUS

    The Sprint/SoftBank rumors just won't stop. MetroPCS (PCS -0.8%) has spiked higher (mostly...

    The Sprint/SoftBank rumors just won't stop. MetroPCS (PCS -0.8%) has spiked higher (mostly erasing its early losses) on a report from the Nikkei that SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) will buy the discount carrier via Sprint (S +13.1%). But David Faber's sources claim SoftBank isn't talking with MetroPCS. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • ISHCQ

    International Shipholding (ISH +2.7%) moves higher after acquiring dry bulk and break-bulk...

    International Shipholding (ISH +2.7%) moves higher after acquiring dry bulk and break-bulk commodity shipper U.S. United Ocean Services, a wholly-owned subsidiary of United Maritime Group, for approximately $111M in cash. The acquisition gives ISH increased scale and a more diverse product offering within the U.S. Flag Jones Act dry bulk transportation market, where it already holds a strong position.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • SLB

    Oil equipment suppliers Schlumberger (SLB +2.2%) and Lufkin (LUFK +3.3%) are advancing after...

    Oil equipment suppliers Schlumberger (SLB +2.2%) and Lufkin (LUFK +3.3%) are advancing after Howard Weil upgrades their shares (I, II). While land drilling servicers have seen earnings numbers adjusted lower over the last month, the firm thinks the earnings picture looks brighter in oilfield equipment and offshore drilling, where fundamentals continue to improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -2.5%) slips after ITG Research claims the company's Q3 domestic sales are...

    Expedia (EXPE -2.5%) slips after ITG Research claims the company's Q3 domestic sales are tracking to $640M, below a $643M consensus. Other online travel names are also lower: PCLN -1.3%. TRIP -2.8%. KYAK -2%. Priceline's soft Q3 guidance put online travel investors on edge in August.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +8%) pops after announcing earlier today that it had made...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +8%) pops after announcing earlier today that it had made appointments to a couple of newly created positions, naming E. Robert Wassman, M.D. as its chief medical officer, and Dganit Bar, Ph.D., as its chief scientific officer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.8%) reportedly is selling more than 28K net acres in the Granite Wash...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.8%) reportedly is selling more than 28K net acres in the Granite Wash and Hogshooter Wash areas in western Oklahoma, an oil-and-gas play it recently called a "significant boost" to its long-term strategy. CEO Aubrey McClendon had called Hogshooter "one of the best oil wells drilled onshore in the Lower 48 in the past several decades."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 7 Comments
  • KITD

    Volatile KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -12.7%) has plummeted to new all-time lows, though no news has...

    Volatile KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -12.7%) has plummeted to new all-time lows, though no news has hit the wires explaining the move. Over the course of 2012, KIT has seen management changes, board changes, job cuts, and a 4,000-mile HQ move.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +41.5%) has tripped up circuit breakers as the 4G network owner cancels a...

    Clearwire (CLWR +41.5%) has tripped up circuit breakers as the 4G network owner cancels a Deutsche conference appearance and takes a prominent role in Sprint/SoftBank rumors. David Faber now says Sprint (S +11.1%), rather than SoftBank, would acquire Clearwire in any deal, while SoftBank would take a 70%+ stake in Sprint. Faber's sources claim the odds of a deal are still above 50/50, but have been diminished by today's leaks.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S +12.7%)  confirms it's in talks with SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) about a "potential...

    Sprint (S +12.7%)  confirms it's in talks with SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) about a "potential substantial investment" that could lead to a change of control. In an e-mail to employees, CEO Dan Hesse cautions the deal "may or may not occur." (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    Shares of IMAX (IMAX +5.5%) run up a gain on heavy volume a day after Credit Suisse initiates...

    Shares of IMAX (IMAX +5.5%) run up a gain on heavy volume a day after Credit Suisse initiates the name with an Outperform rating and $28 price target. Increasingly tagged as a China play with the nation devouring the IMAX large-screen format, the company is starting to see its grand plans for expansion in China affect the broader film industry. The movie script for the remake of Red Dawn was altered so that the protagonists were North Korean - instead of Chinese - with censorship boards in mind.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil (MUR +2.7%) moves higher after activist hedge fund Third Point wins U.S. antitrust...

    Murphy Oil (MUR +2.7%) moves higher after activist hedge fund Third Point wins U.S. antitrust approval to buy an unspecified stake in the company. MUR has climbed 5% since Third Point's Dan Loeb told the fund's investors that shares could be 60% higher if the company would take steps such as selling fuel stations and other downstream operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • RYL

    MKM Partners is recomending that investors take some profit off the table in the homebuilders as...

    MKM Partners is recomending that investors take some profit off the table in the homebuilders as sales growth looks to be slowing. it cuts Ryland Group (NYSE:RYL) to Sell, and D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) and Lennar (NYSE:LEN) to Neutral. (I, II, III)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • S

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLWR +37%. USAT +27%. OTC:PURE +22%. ANR +15%. ACI +14%. S +13%. DRWI...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLWR +37%. USAT +27%. OTC:PURE +22%. ANR +15%. ACI +14%. S +13%. DRWI +13%. PATK +12%. OSK +12%. JKS +12%.
    Top 10 Losers: PRSS -16%. OTC:KITD -12%. CMN -11%. OTT -10%. WSO -10%. DLTR -9%. CLNT -8%. SWC -8%. BSDM -8%. ONE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO +1.8%) reportedly is set to sell off ~230 onshore wells in the U.S. as it looks to...

    Statoil (STO +1.8%) reportedly is set to sell off ~230 onshore wells in the U.S. as it looks to shed gas producers following the plunge in North American natural gas prices. The tally is said to include 180 onshore natural gas wells STO gained through last year's $4.4B acquisition of Brigham Exploration.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • CECO

    Education stocks ride higher after Credit Suisse comes with out a somewhat counterintuitive take...

    Education stocks ride higher after Credit Suisse comes with out a somewhat counterintuitive take that the for-profit sector will fare better with Mitt Romney as the President instead of Obama. Earlier this week, BofA lifted estimates for a number of education names on its view that new enrollment declines may level off. Leading advancers: CECO +5.9%, BPI +5.4%, DV +4.4%, ESI-OLD +4.3%, APOL +3.0%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • FDO

    A downwardly revised forecast from Dollar Tree for earnings spills over to taint other...

    A downwardly revised forecast from Dollar Tree for earnings spills over to taint other discounting names as the sector starts to get a harder look from investors. Decliners: FDO -2.0%, DG -2.4%, FIVE -1.1%. (DLTR webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • DLTR

    Shares of Dollar Tree (DLTR -6.9%) dive after the company sets guidance at the low end of the...

    Shares of Dollar Tree (DLTR -6.9%) dive after the company sets guidance at the low end of the expected range while presenting at an investor conference. Reading between the lines from the comments of execs, it appears the company is starting to run out of growth drivers. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +6%) moves up after announcing its begun its Athena clinical trial to...

    Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +6%) moves up after announcing its begun its Athena clinical trial to investigate it's cell therapy in patients who suffer from a severe form of untreatable heart failure due to chronic myocardial ischemia. The first patient was treated at the Minneapolis Heart Institute Foundation in September and has already undergone a seven day follow-up assessment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • GRPN

    After falling yesterday in response to news of eBay's entry into the daily deals market, Groupon...

    After falling yesterday in response to news of eBay's entry into the daily deals market, Groupon (GRPN +4.2%) is rallying today. AdAge reports Groupon is planning a new ad campaign that will launch in Q1, and plans to select an agency partner this quarter. Evercore recently claimed Groupon's marketing expenses are rising again after a 1H decline, as the company tries to boost flagging daily deals sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • OSK

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK +13.1%) jet higher after Carl Icahn offers $32.50 a share for the...

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK +13.1%) jet higher after Carl Icahn offers $32.50 a share for the company. Analysts see the end game for Icahn still being a combined Oshkosh and Navistar. NAV +5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF +2.7%) and other fertilizer stocks rally after the U.S. government says...

    CF Industries (CF +2.7%) and other fertilizer stocks rally after the U.S. government says corn inventories will fall even more than expected following the Midwest drought; global inventories will hit 117M metric tons as of Oct. 1, down from an estimate of 124M last month. "This report signals there is absolutely no supply cushion," a trader says. Also: MOS +2.1%, POT +2%, AGU +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • CRMD

    CorMedix (CRMD +6.7%) takes a step towards achieving compliance with European regulatory...

    CorMedix (CRMD +6.7%) takes a step towards achieving compliance with European regulatory requirements, saying that it's successfully passed the ISO 13485:2003 certification. The ISO 13485 is a globally recognized standard that outlines consistent international processes for the design and manufacturing of medical devices. The company anticipates a final review and determination of its CE Mark application by the end of Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • ENG

    ENGlobal (ENG +10.7%) shares soar on news it hired Simmons & Co. to explore possible...

    ENGlobal (ENG +10.7%) shares soar on news it hired Simmons & Co. to explore possible strategic alternatives, including a sale of the company or some of its assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal stocks are enjoying notable strength today, as natural gas hits multi-month highs, +4% to...

    Coal stocks are enjoying notable strength today, as natural gas hits multi-month highs, +4% to $3.61/btu. Dahlman Rose predicts demand may be on the rise from steel manufacturers in China; the boost in iron ore prices this week also is a bullish factor. ANR +12.1%, ACI +10.9%, JRCC +10.1%, ACI +7.7%, BTU +7.5%, CNX +6.3%, WLT +5.7%, CLD +5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • KHC

    Kraft Foods Group (KRFT -1.2%) plans to launch Maxwell House cups for Green Mountain (GMCR...

    Kraft Foods Group (KRFT -1.2%) plans to launch Maxwell House cups for Green Mountain (GMCR -0.5%) brewers, according to Reuters. The company says the cups will be produced outside of any licensing agreement with Green Mountain. After spiking sharply lower after the story broke, GMCR has recovered a good portion of the ground lost as traders digest that the development wasn't wholly unexpected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 4 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -1.9%) trades higher with positive K-Cup data out from...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -1.9%) trades higher with positive K-Cup data out from Nielsen. Though the company's market share slipped 80 bps during the tracking period, the market as a whole rose more than enough to compensate.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +5.2%) jumps after filing its FY12 10-K. Shares of the heavily-shorted...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +5.2%) jumps after filing its FY12 10-K. Shares of the heavily-shorted Wi-Fi equipment vendor fell last week after the filing was delayed.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • ICPT

    Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) IPO opens for trading at $19.40, a 29% premium to its...

    Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) IPO opens for trading at $19.40, a 29% premium to its $15 top-range IPO pricing. The company plans to use the funds to develop its lead drug candidate, obeticholic acid, which is a treatment for a rare autoimmune liver disease. The drug is a potential blockbuster for the company, and  is currently in Phase III trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • S

    More on Sprint/SoftBank: David Faber claims SoftBank's talks with Sprint (S +19%) also cover the...

    More on Sprint/SoftBank: David Faber claims SoftBank's talks with Sprint (S +19%) also cover the acquisition of Clearwire (CLWR +38.8%). He adds a 3-way deal featuring T-Mobile was considered, but talks fell apart due to antitrust concerns, leading T-Mobile to go after MetroPCS (PCS -6.1%). Sources tell Faber a SoftBank/Sprint deal, though not yet finalized, could happen in a week or two. SoftBank reportedly thinks Sprint and Clearwire's spectrum will allow it to challenge the AT&T/Verizon "duopoly." (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • CEO

    The Canadian government extends its review of Cnooc’s (CEO +3.4%) planned takeover of...

    The Canadian government extends its review of Cnooc’s (CEO +3.4%) planned takeover of Nexen (NXY +0.6%) by 30 days and suggests another extension may follow. PM Stephen Harper’s government is reviewing the bid under Canada’s foreign takeover law, which specifies transactions must have a "net benefit" for the country in order to win approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • SSTK

    Shutterstock (NYSE:SSTK) posts a strong IPO. After pricing its 4.5M-share offering at $17, the...

    Shutterstock (NYSE:SSTK) posts a strong IPO. After pricing its 4.5M-share offering at $17, the stock photo site opened at $22.50 and is currently moving at $22.12, up 30.1%. That gives Shutterstock a market cap of $726.4M. (S-1) (1H results)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • FAST

    Fastenal (FAST +8.6%) moves up despite a mixed Q3 result, reporting in-line on a per share basis...

    Fastenal (FAST +8.6%) moves up despite a mixed Q3 result, reporting in-line on a per share basis but slightly short on the revenue side. Net income actually rose 13% Y/Y, marking a fourth consecutive quarter of growth as the operator of industrial hardware supply stores continues to open new stores in response to heavy manufacturing demand. The company has opened 73 new stores this year, bringing its total store count 2,650. Margins slipped on the increase in expansion costs, to 51.6% from 51.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +3.2%) says Q3 production volumes exceeded the upper range of guidance,...

    Range Resources (RRC +3.2%) says Q3 production volumes exceeded the upper range of guidance, averaging 790 MMcfe/day, up 47% Y/Y and up 10% Q/Q; natural gas totaled 623.3 MMcf/day on average, 79% of total production. CEO Jeff Ventura says RRC is on track to meet its 35% production growth target for the year and was able to stay within its original capex budget.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney's (JCP +6.5%) apparent return to couponing has investors piling back in as shares...

    J.C. Penney's (JCP +6.5%) apparent return to couponing has investors piling back in as shares hit their highest levels in two weeks. Retail analyst Stacey Widlitz can't help but note that it only took management two to three quarters of -20% comps to get back on board with coupons. But will long-time shoppers come back into the fold with many fashion lines quite different?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 9 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S +12.6%) has given back a chunk of the early gains it saw on a report SoftBank is in...

    Sprint (S +12.6%) has given back a chunk of the early gains it saw on a report SoftBank is in talks to buy a majority stake in the #3 U.S. carrier. SoftBank's cool response to the report - the Japanese carrier calls it "based on speculation" - might have something to do with the pullback. Analyst Kevin Roe thinks the report could indicate a ~$6.40/share offer price - Sprint is currently moving at $5.68. Verizon (VZ -1.2%) and AT&T (T -0.9%) are off moderately. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.4%) trades higher a day after a highly-anticipated presentation at the...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.4%) trades higher a day after a highly-anticipated presentation at the Liberty Media Investor Meeting. Though the showstopper was the revelation that the company expects its Nook and college bookstore businesses to kick up $3B this year, plans to hit nine new international markts with its digital bookstore by next June also raised a few eyebrows.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +2.9%) is trekking higher following the U.S. government's official imposition...

    First Solar (FSLR +2.9%) is trekking higher following the U.S. government's official imposition of anti-dumping tariffs against Chinese solar vendors, and LDK Solar (LDK -2.9%) and Suntech (STP -2.7%) are doing the opposite. The Chinese government was quick to denounce the tariffs, which are accompanied by countervailing duties of 15%-16%. But some U.S. manufacturers are disappointed the duties don't cover Chinese solar modules made with non-Chinese cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3.1%) catches a bid after ITG forecasts Q3 revenue will come in at $255M,...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +3.1%) catches a bid after ITG forecasts Q3 revenue will come in at $255M, soundly above a $244M consensus. The business social networking leader has delivered a string of revenue beats, and the Street seems to be pricing in another one.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • GT

    Shares of Goodyear Tire (GT +1.7%) trade higher after a potential buyout of Cooper Tire &...

    Shares of Goodyear Tire (GT +1.7%) trade higher after a potential buyout of Cooper Tire & Rubber raises the profile of the sector. The stock has also some caught some interest as of late with its low earnings multiples looking better in the face of strength in the U.S. auto market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +3.4%) rallies after Sterne Agee says North American sales of the company's...

    Riverbed (RVBD +3.4%) rallies after Sterne Agee says North American sales of the company's bread-and-butter WAN optimization hardware will remain strong through year's end. ThinkEquity and William Blair have also recently made favorable comments about Riverbed's near-term sales. Riverbed has rallied strongly since July on expectations new products and a sales reorg are going to pay off.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • JCP

    Back to the future: Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +4.8%) race higher at the open with word out that...

    Back to the future: Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +4.8%) race higher at the open with word out that the retailer sent $10 coupons to customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures riding high, possibly due to a number of factors, not least...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures riding high, possibly due to a number of factors, not least strong weekly jobless data - till next week's revision at least. S&P benchmark +0.5%. An upgrade of U.S. stocks by Citigroup may also be boosting sentiment as markets on both sides of the Atlantic brush off S&P's downgrade of Spain. Sprint jumps 17.3% on buyout speculation involving Japan's Softbank, with Clearwire soaring as well. Later: Fed's Plosser
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) +9.6% premarket after it says a preliminary study of its...

    Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) +9.6% premarket after it says a preliminary study of its treatment for Pompe disease showed positive results; AT2220-enzyme replacement therapy co-administration increased pompe enzyme activity in first three dose cohorts in the phase 2 study.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Grains soar as the USDA lowers its estimate of corn ending stocks to 619M bushels from 733M in...

    Grains soar as the USDA lowers its estimate of corn ending stocks to 619M bushels from 733M in September. The cut comes even as it raises its forecast of harvested acres to 360K. What happens, asks Arlan Suderman, if the USDA is forced to cut harvested acres in its next report? Yikes. Corn +4%, Beans +2.1%, Wheat +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) +29.2% following a report SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) is thinking of buying a...

    Clearwire (CLWR) +29.2% following a report SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) is thinking of buying a majority stake in Sprint (NYSE:S) - investors are clearly betting Sprint's 4G network partner will also turn into a takeover candidate. However, MetroPCS (PCS) is down 7.8%, as the Street assumes a Softbank deal will lower the odds of a Sprint counter-offer to the T-Mobile deal, and perhaps put the carrier in a worse competitive position. Leap Wireless (LEAP) +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +28%. S +19%. CTB +16%. DRWI +16%. FOLD +7%. Losers: PCS -8%. SWC -5%.

    Premarket gainers: CLWR +28%. S +19%. CTB +16%. DRWI +16%. FOLD +7%.
    Losers: PCS -8%. SWC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (NYSE:CTB) is in the sights of Apollo Tyres, according to reporting from...

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (NYSE:CTB) is in the sights of Apollo Tyres, according to reporting from The Economic Times. Shares +17.7% premarket as a hefty premium is rumored to be in the mix.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMD

    Cantel Medical (CMN): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $98.7M (+15% Y/Y) misses by...

    Cantel Medical (CMN): FQ4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $98.7M (+15% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -6.8% premarket. (PR)
